children.text: When children first join Wellyboots they will be allowed to settle in at their own pace.

We encourage parents or carers to visit the premises with their children shortly before they are due to start. This gives the children the opportunity to look around Wellyboots and ask any questions. It also gives parents the opportunity to complete the necessary paperwork for registration with Wellyboots if this has not yet been done.
If necessary, parents or carers may stay with their children during the first week to help them settle in.
Induction for new children
The new child will be introduced to all members of staff and informed about any other regular visitors to Wellyboots.
EYFS children and their parents will be introduced to their key workers.
Wellyboots activities, rules and routines, such as snacks, signing in and signing out, will be explained.
The child will be shown around Wellyboots and told where they can and cannot go.
The fire evacuation procedure and the locations of all fire exits will be explained.
The child will be introduced to the other children at Wellyboots and allocated a ‘buddy’ who will assist them with finding their way around and involving them in activities.
Staff will keep a close eye on the new child and will ensure that they are happy, engaged and feel secure in the Wellyboots environment.
If a child seems to be taking an unusually long time to settle in, this will be discussed with their parents or carers to see what can be done to make the transition easier.
Written in accordance with the

Statutory Framework for the Early Years Foundation Stage (2021): Safeguarding and Welfare Requirements: Information and Records [3.72-3.73]; Safety and Suitability of Premises, Environment and Equipment [3.55]
